entry.title: Redshift for the Greek Alphabet (WIP)
entry.content:
Introduction and References

In this post I am going to discuss a conjecture of Angelini-Knoll in his paper on detecting beta elements in K-Theory.

entry.title: Motivic Filtrations on TP/TC (WIP)
entry.content:
Introduction and References

In this post I am going to write about a pair of papers, BMS2 and HRW in order to explain the construction of certain filtrations on Topological Cyclic homology for quasisyntomic discrete rings (the BMS paper) and chromatically quasisyntomic commutative ring spectra (the HRW paper).

The goal of this note is to expand upon some of the constructions in both papers and hopefully provide a useful exposition in the process.

Preliminaries for the Discrete Case

Reminders on THH, TC, and TP

Homotopy Fixed Point and Tate Spectral Sequences

The sites QRSP and QSyn

Preliminaries for the Ring Spectrum Case

Chromatically Quasisyntomic Rings

A Filtered Model for Stable Motivic Homotopy

entry.title: An Exposition on Nilpotence 1 (WIP)
entry.content:
Introduction and References

In this post I am going to try to explain the three step argument of Hopkins-Ravenel-Smith in their celebrated Nilpotence 1 paper. Step 3 in particular is easy to get lost in, and much of this post will be dedicated to emphasizing my personal take on which details one should focus on when reading this paper. At the end, I will briefly mention my own work on providing quantitative bounds on nilpotence orders via recursive estimates.

Some Preliminaries

The Proof

Step 1

Step 2

Step 3
